businessProfile.name: Beau Jo's Idaho Springs
businessProfile.address: 1517 Miner St, Idaho Springs, CO 80452, USA
businessProfile.formatted_address: 1517 Miner St, Idaho Springs, CO 80452, USA

reviews.text: Sometime 20+ years my boss took me and some of my coworkers here.  I loved it and I  need to visit this place again.  We are staying in Avon so I thought it's now or never.   We enjoyed our lunch and love their Mountain Pie where you van put honey on the crust.

Fantastic pizza üçï  my son loved it. Inside there is plenty of tables but we sat in the bar area. Cute little town with street parking just off the main road. I definitely recommend stopping by. We enjoyed being able to watch sports at the bar as well and there were big tables to accommodate bigger parties as well. Loved the honey crust and the service was very nice as well. We will be visiting again soon. Thank you for the great hospitality

So let‚Äôs just get the obvious portion out of the way, for a pizza place this is what I would consider expensive. For a restaurant in Colorado, It is not but when you consider that their primary dish is pizza, it is (37$ just for our large). Now that we‚Äôve covered that, it is delicious pizza worth every single dollar! If plain hand tossed or New York style isn‚Äôt your thing, which is what they call Prairie crust, go for the mountain style crust and make sure to throw some honey on it at the end. Just trust me we had a ton of fun eating here. The environment was great. It had a moderate noise level but easy to converse, and the food was absolutely delicious. Get the honey cheese bread and put honey on top of it. Pictured below is the Pacific Plantation in their 3lb (Large) size, fed me and my wife and I‚Äôm a 6‚Äô1‚Äù competition bodybuilder, could easily feed a family of 4! We will return or visit other locations!

I‚Äôm not from Colorado but my wife is and she has ALWAYS said it is a staple and a must.  HOWEVER!!! Only Idaho Springs can do it.  The others are not the same.
I‚Äôm NEVER disappointed when I go to this great place!  We order 2 different large pizzas and sometimes a couple different appetizers.  The Hearty Arty is artichoke dip with different veggies.  Don‚Äôt forget to honey up your crust!!!

I used to love this place and recommended it to others. We made the mistake of ordering a thin crust pizza, and not the original. The dough was still gooey. The cheese was still shredded, not melted together all over. Toppings were dumped on one side primarily and not the other. We sent the pizza back to be cooked. The experience was ruined by then, though,  and the dough did not really cook any more. We went out of our way to eat here, and likely won't do that again.  On a side note, my seat was covered in honey as I found out later. üòÉ Had the waiter been slightly apologetic for anything, I might have left a more positive review. The pizza and sticky seat were not her fault, but she was dismissive of both complaints.  It's ok to make some mistakes, but not half cooked pizza dough with cheese that's not melted all of the way. Working in a kitchen isn't easy, but delivering a cooked pizza should be easily accomplished after all the years they've been in business. I'll just add this: my husband had no problem with the half-cooked crust. The flavor was still true to what we both knew and loved, but again, I prefer a piping hot pizza.

editorial_summary.overview: Regional chain specializing in Colorado-style, thick-crust pizza with many sauces, plus calzones.

recentReviews.text:
Went to the Idaho Springs location this summer & boy has it changed ‚Ä¶ and not for the better! It used to be a treat going to this pizza joint, been going there since the 70s.
It‚Äôs soooo crowded, parking can be impossible, be prepared to wait for a table. Once we finally got seated there were so many flies around our table buzzing about, live one‚Äôs & dead ones too. Yuck. The tall guy with long hair literally threw our pizza down onto the table, very rude. Didn‚Äôt speak a word to us. He wasn‚Äôt our waitress,  just dropped off our food‚Ä¶ literally!! The food was meh‚Ä¶ nothing like I remembered. The Beau Joes in Lonetree is better than this experience. Lonetree welcomed us & treated us like they cared. No flies either!
I spent alot of ‚Äúdough‚Äù there in Idaho Springs, it‚Äôs not cheap to have a family of 5 go out for a special occasion. I expected better based on past years. Idaho Springs is just sooo crowded & combine that with traffic from hell & not so great food- we won‚Äôt be back. ‚òπÔ∏è
Alyssa P was our server and she was just the nicest. The food was amazing and as always the atmosphere was great. We love this location and travel from Aurora CO just to visit
The pizza was really good but they charge for each topping and also add 20% tip which came down to huge bill including taxes, so 50 dollars for one small size pizza was definitely not worth.
Seriously some of the best pizza I've had. Their crust is perfect.

Best pizza in Colorado!  Ambiance of the old building is so inviting.  The staff is super-friendly and attentive.  I actually felt that this place was very familiar to me.  I discovered that I actually had pizza there over 30 years ago!  And it did not disappoint once again.  It's a must try if you are in the Idaho Springs area.
Pizza üçï, as well as the honey were top-notch!  Also, the Green Chili!? Uhhmazing!! Too bad it's only a cup, and not a bowl.  NOTICE: They do not split check's.

We stopped here for lunch while on a tour.  Our tour guide suggested the pizza and it was a great recommendation.  The pizza was delicious.   Especially with some honey on the crust.   Wait for food was short.   Prices were reasonable.  Service and food were great.

detailedReviews.author: Hippychick
detailedReviews.text:
Went to the Idaho Springs location this summer & boy has it changed ‚Ä¶ and not for the better! It used to be a treat going to this pizza joint, been going there since the 70s.
It‚Äôs soooo crowded, parking can be impossible, be prepared to wait for a table. Once we finally got seated there were so many flies around our table buzzing about, live one‚Äôs & dead ones too. Yuck. The tall guy with long hair literally threw our pizza down onto the table, very rude. Didn‚Äôt speak a word to us. He wasn‚Äôt our waitress,  just dropped off our food‚Ä¶ literally!! The food was meh‚Ä¶ nothing like I remembered. The Beau Joes in Lonetree is better than this experience. Lonetree welcomed us & treated us like they cared. No flies either!

detailedReviews.author: awatters52
detailedReviews.text: Alyssa P was our server and she was just the nicest. The food was amazing and as always the atmosphere was great. We love this location and travel from Aurora CO just to visit

detailedReviews.author: Seema Mahajan
detailedReviews.text: The pizza was really good but they charge for each topping and also add 20% tip which came down to huge bill including taxes, so 50 dollars for one small size pizza was definitely not worth.

detailedReviews.author: Aaron Dawson
detailedReviews.text: Seriously some of the best pizza I've had. Their crust is perfect.

detailedReviews.author: Julie Nagorski
detailedReviews.text: Best pizza in Colorado!  Ambiance of the old building is so inviting.  The staff is super-friendly and attentive.  I actually felt that this place was very familiar to me.  I discovered that I actually had pizza there over 30 years ago!  And it did not disappoint once again.  It's a must try if you are in the Idaho Springs area.

detailedReviews.author: David Martinez
detailedReviews.text: Pizza üçï, as well as the honey were top-notch!  Also, the Green Chili!? Uhhmazing!! Too bad it's only a cup, and not a bowl.  NOTICE: They do not split check's.

detailedReviews.author: Sarah W
detailedReviews.text: We stopped here for lunch while on a tour.  Our tour guide suggested the pizza and it was a great recommendation.  The pizza was delicious.   Especially with some honey on the crust.   Wait for food was short.   Prices were reasonable.  Service and food were great.

detailedReviews.author: Marbelis Acosta Niesing
detailedReviews.text:
My husband had this place recommended to him, but it turned out to be the worst pizza experience of our lives.

I first ordered an Espresso Martini, but they didn‚Äôt even have coffee liqueur. Then I tried a Margarita, it was the worst I‚Äôve ever had. It was extremely acidic and overly sweet, totally undrinkable. I even went up to the bar to get a glass of soda water to mix it and later asked for another one, but nothing worked, so I basically paid $11 + tax for a drink I couldn‚Äôt even touch. My husband couldn‚Äôt drink it either.

We ordered the Pacific Plantation, and it was a disaster. The slices fell apart like mush, the sauce was watery and flavorless (just onion), and the pineapple and mushrooms were soggy and bland. It was practically soup, I had to place my slice on a napkin just to try to eat it. The only thing somewhat decent in this ‚Äúpizza pur√©e‚Äù was the pepperoni. Honestly, a frozen pizza, or even a Costco pizza, would have been way better.

To make matters worse, our server (an older gentleman) seemed annoyed and unfriendly from the start, and we were charged full price at 5:30 pm instead of happy hour.

We wasted $80 on this terrible experience. 0% recommended. Never again!

detailedReviews.author: Trever Across town
detailedReviews.text:
Great pizza
Or
Mountain pies

detailedReviews.author: Christie Treadway
detailedReviews.text: Pizza was excellent, place is dated back to the 40‚Äôs. We were sat in the front window and on both sides were full fly strips. There was an ultraviolet light a foot above my table. I just hope the kitchen isn‚Äôt as unsanitary. Be Aware: they close at 9pm, but lock the doors at 8:15pm. We watched at least 20 people turned away, and we left at 8:40pm.

detailedReviews.author: Michael Cole
detailedReviews.text: Great pizza we tried the BLT w/ added hot honey crust and Tiptop. Flavors are as described in the menu. Honey cheese bread was great as well, its a must try combo.

detailedReviews.author: Sarah Johnsen
detailedReviews.text: Great place to stop on the way home from skiing.

detailedReviews.author: Dan Lorenz
detailedReviews.text: Visited Beau Jo's Idaho Springs August 31st 2025. First time I had been back there in 16 years! It was just as amazing as I remembered. It was like being a kid again! The mountain pie was fantastic. The crust & honey was magical as always! $65 for a pizza & 4 soft drinks! Our waitress was great! We didn't wait too long despite it being very busy to it being a holiday weekend (Labor Day) It's a special Colorado experience that everyone should try! üçï

detailedReviews.author: Emily Prudhome
detailedReviews.text: The food and service were good. You have to order carryout if you want to sit outside.

detailedReviews.author: Jackson Goodwin.
detailedReviews.text: Really great pizza as always. Love the honey. This place is busy. Get there early, make reservations.

detailedReviews.author: P Castle
detailedReviews.text: Amazing food and the cutest location

detailedReviews.author: Becky Shires
detailedReviews.text: First time enjoying Colorado style pizza.  We had the Lil' Italy with the new Hot n' Honey crust and added Italian sausage.  Oh, wow!  Soo good.  The tomato paired very well with the hot crust.  All of the toppings were fresh and they have some nice craft beers on tap.  The bartender, Claudia, was super helpful and perfectly attentive, not too much not too little.  Thank you, Claudia and staff!  We'll see you soon.

detailedReviews.author: Zachary Bergstrom
detailedReviews.text: Always a treat to come here.  Didn't give a full five stars because, I dont know when they took away the stuffed pies.  Was looking forward to that as it had been several years since we'd been able to make it up there.

detailedReviews.author: Scott Mauch
detailedReviews.text: Outstanding place a true piece of history

detailedReviews.author: Silvia Phelps
detailedReviews.text: Appreciated our server, Melissa, explaining difference between a mountain and prairie pie. Good food is always a plus, however, excellent service will bring me back.

detailedReviews.author: Stephanie Burkett
detailedReviews.text: Thank you Melissa! Our first time visiting Idaho Springs and Beau Jo's and both were perfect and memorable! Highly recommend if you're looking to try a nice twist on a "mountain pie".

detailedReviews.author: Justin T
detailedReviews.text: This location is a cool place to grab some delicious pizza either inside or outdoors when the weather is nice as well. We loved the crust on the pizza with the honey drizzled over it, absolutely delicious! The service was great at this location as well. We will definitely stop again when we are out vacationing in the area!

detailedReviews.author: Aaron Reynolds
detailedReviews.text: Great food great atmosphere and great service!!

detailedReviews.author: Matt Burditt
detailedReviews.text: Awesome place. Best one in CO

detailedReviews.author: Mark Hunt
detailedReviews.text: Best beer and pizza ever!!

detailedReviews.author: Samantha Fischer
detailedReviews.text:
Had fun with Joe the waiter. Food is delicious. Service is attentive. Wait time was understandable, well managed and well worth it.
It's Beau Jo's

detailedReviews.author: Pablo Andres Gomez
detailedReviews.text: Awesome place. Good service. We didn‚Äôt enjoy our food so much. More emphasis on bread than anything else. Would still come back!

detailedReviews.author: Sarah Blincoe Munoz
detailedReviews.text: Pizza was soggy. Hostest was so rude. Never again

detailedReviews.author: Cassie Tay
detailedReviews.text: NOT dog-friendly

detailedReviews.author: Josh T
detailedReviews.text: So we like this place it‚Äôs an iconic pizza place in an awesome town. However I ordered a Bloody Mary it was probably the worst Iv ever had in my life. Tomato juice and vodka with a lemon wedge. No rimmer no olive no spice no nothing litterally the ugliest worst thing ever. We also ordered a pizza with additional toppings and they just weren‚Äôt there I dunno pretty average experience.

detailedReviews.author: Rick
detailedReviews.text: Staff and Food were disgusting

detailedReviews.author: Josiah Skaar
detailedReviews.text: Simply yummy

detailedReviews.author: RoseAnn Lauer
detailedReviews.text: Nice place for family dinner. Pizza is great. Love the "crustless" option. Something for everyone.

detailedReviews.author: Holden Cotzin
detailedReviews.text:
Awful pizza, store bought frozen pizza is far better. Waste of money. When trying to get my pickup order the tall black guy that was hosting wouldn‚Äôt respond with word and was just pointing and mumbling to make the girl host laugh. I was respectfully asking where to pick up my $100+ order as their staff laughed at my face for not knowing where the pickup area was in a restaurant I‚Äôve never been to and the host just mocked me. Terrible experience I won‚Äôt be back and I don‚Äôt recommend anyone else waste your money. Pickup any pizza at the grocery store for far better food.

Watch the video with the Asian girl eating the pizza. That‚Äôs how every Beau Jo‚Äôs pizza experience is.

detailedReviews.author: todd challis
detailedReviews.text: Beau Jo's is a wonderful experience! The only issue I have the exorbitant price for a pizza.

detailedReviews.author: Ant√≥nio Salsinha
detailedReviews.text: Amazing pizza üçï ü§©üòç

detailedReviews.author: Cameron Cannon
detailedReviews.text: While the food was great and our server was fantastic, the hostess at the front desk could not have been more rude person to not only our party, but others as well; she was extremely standoffish and unwilling to help. Her impact was enough for our whole party to agree that we won‚Äôt be coming back anytime soon.

detailedReviews.author: Jerry Hamilton
detailedReviews.text: I Love Beau Jos pizza its the best in the Rockies

detailedReviews.author: eric heinz
detailedReviews.text: Great place to stop in and have some pizza

detailedReviews.author: Ariel McMaster
detailedReviews.text: John C was our server and he didn‚Äôt come and check on us. We didn‚Äôt get refills on our drinks. When we got his attention it was like he was annoyed with us. I was extremely frustrated with the service. My wife‚Äôs Calzone the dough was raw. I didn‚Äôt bother trying to get the waiter‚Äôs attention because again trying to get him over to us was hard. My wife ended up really sick last night from the food she ate. We are really dissatisfied with everything.

detailedReviews.author: Randy Torres
detailedReviews.text: Sometime 20+ years my boss took me and some of my coworkers here.  I loved it and I  need to visit this place again.  We are staying in Avon so I thought it's now or never.   We enjoyed our lunch and love their Mountain Pie where you van put honey on the crust.

detailedReviews.author: H. Camm
detailedReviews.text: I used to love this place and recommended it to others. We made the mistake of ordering a thin crust pizza, and not the original. The dough was still gooey. The cheese was still shredded, not melted together all over. Toppings were dumped on one side primarily and not the other. We sent the pizza back to be cooked. The experience was ruined by then, though,  and the dough did not really cook any more. We went out of our way to eat here, and likely won't do that again.  On a side note, my seat was covered in honey as I found out later. üòÉ Had the waiter been slightly apologetic for anything, I might have left a more positive review. The pizza and sticky seat were not her fault, but she was dismissive of both complaints.  It's ok to make some mistakes, but not half cooked pizza dough with cheese that's not melted all of the way. Working in a kitchen isn't easy, but delivering a cooked pizza should be easily accomplished after all the years they've been in business. I'll just add this: my husband had no problem with the half-cooked crust. The flavor was still true to what we both knew and loved, but again, I prefer a piping hot pizza.

detailedReviews.author: Paul Benschoter
detailedReviews.text: Awesome pizza! Honey for the crust is perfect.

detailedReviews.author: Sue Anderson
detailedReviews.text: Robby took great care of our group of 10. It was a perfect lunch stop.

detailedReviews.author: Amber Kuspiel
detailedReviews.text: We were pretty bummed this visit. The gluten-free pizza is usually awesome, but this time the crust was lukewarm and kind of odd, like it hadn‚Äôt fully cooked‚Äîeven though the toppings were fine. The mushroom appetizer was also tiny, which was surprising. Our server was super nice but so busy that by the time she checked on us, we were already ready to leave.

detailedReviews.author: Huck Huckster
detailedReviews.text: Always good.  Paid parking is Bullshit but its not Beau Jos fault

detailedReviews.author: Kristy Thomas
detailedReviews.text: Pizza was so good... I want more. Honey?? Sounds crazy but it is so good!

detailedReviews.author: Daniel Moulton
detailedReviews.text:
The absolute only reason I am giving this place a 2 star is that the pizza was truly good. My family showed up because of a last great experience there by my daughter, unfortunately this time we had brought our dog on the trip. We were informed that we couldn't dine inside or outside, and so spent over $60 bucks for takeout. While waiting for the food we noticed that others had their dogs in the outside seating area on the street, so we asked if we could sit there and enjoy our pizza and the host said ok. Moments later the server for the area came over and said we couldn't sit there for our take out, but may make the concession because they were not busy. It was a really uncomfortable situation, made worse by the fact that all we really wanted to do was to sit there and dine and enjoy their pizza in the first place.
Exceptionally bad customer service. Good pizza, sounds like a moment for staff training

detailedReviews.author: Owen Barry
detailedReviews.text: Really good

detailedReviews.author: Christopher Castoro
detailedReviews.text: Wonderful pizza, friendly service and great views.

detailedReviews.author: Parisa Javedani
detailedReviews.text: Food was great, service was fantastic. Robby was great, attentive, and on top of everything despite a busy afternoon. Beautiful day, patio was lovely.

detailedReviews.author: Cameron Saccomanno
detailedReviews.text: We arrived shortly after it opened. It wasn't very busy but quickly got super busy. There were three of us and we each ordered a different pizza. Each pizza was great. We drove well out of our way to go here and it was worth the drive.

detailedReviews.author: Mark Hollcraft
detailedReviews.text:
Sheena was excellent in her presentation and informational about the city and history.
A must try if you land here.

detailedReviews.author: Mike Galvin
detailedReviews.text: This pizza is some of the best I've ever tasted.  I like the venue inside and the excellent wait staff.  I recommend the thicker crust option which allows you to spread honey on it after eating the pizza.  Truly a unique treat and experience!

detailedReviews.author: Susan R
detailedReviews.text: Great stop on our way to Frisco. Melissa did a great job welcoming us and filling us in on how the menu worked. Great pizza. Highly recommend!

detailedReviews.author: Michael and Alex Douglas
detailedReviews.text:
I‚Äôm not from Colorado but my wife is and she has ALWAYS said it is a staple and a must.  HOWEVER!!! Only Idaho Springs can do it.  The others are not the same.
I‚Äôm NEVER disappointed when I go to this great place!  We order 2 different large pizzas and sometimes a couple different appetizers.  The Hearty Arty is artichoke dip with different veggies.  Don‚Äôt forget to honey up your crust!!!

detailedReviews.author: Tim Harlan Schicktanz
detailedReviews.text: The absolutely BEST pizza on earth. The atmosphere is incredible!

detailedReviews.author: Fiona Stokes
detailedReviews.text: learning that beau jo‚Äôs is a chain rather than a local family owned restaurant came as a surprise if not almost slight disappointment that i could not gatekeep this wonderful place. packed with personality, beau jo‚Äôs is where i learned about honey on thick crusted pizzas. it was ground breaking to me as someone who was equally passionate about honey and pizzas. the waitress was very friendly and honest about the amount of pizza our large group should order. i will think of this meal each time i recall my time in the colorado mountains.

detailedReviews.author: Kristin DeKock
detailedReviews.text: This place was so fun! They had napkin drawings hung on the wall. Probably the best pizza I've ever had. You got a go with the classic options. Honey on the crust was probably my favorite part of the dinner.

detailedReviews.author: Jim Gigax
detailedReviews.text: I always like this place but the supposed cajun pizza, festooned with pepperoni and jalapeno peppers, is not cajun pizza, which has chicken, recognizable andouille sausage and shrimp.

detailedReviews.author: brittany hemingway
detailedReviews.text: Fantastic pizza üçï  my son loved it. Inside there is plenty of tables but we sat in the bar area. Cute little town with street parking just off the main road. I definitely recommend stopping by. We enjoyed being able to watch sports at the bar as well and there were big tables to accommodate bigger parties as well. Loved the honey crust and the service was very nice as well. We will be visiting again soon. Thank you for the great hospitality

detailedReviews.author: Kirk Slattery
detailedReviews.text: Awesome pizza. Fantastic service.  Old town atmosphere.

detailedReviews.author: Dr. Zapata
detailedReviews.text: Been there many times. I love their pizza. The seating on the street is also great.

detailedReviews.author: Amanda Lamotte
detailedReviews.text: My family and I loved it. The food was good and our waitress was really nice and helpful. We wish there was Beau Jo's in Missouri!

detailedReviews.author: Ethan Decker
detailedReviews.text:
Here‚Äôs the down and dirty because I‚Äôm not an IG influencer:

The smell wrangled us in from 2 blocks down yonder and will likely be your guide to the front doors as well.

Beau Jo‚Äôs has great pizza and you won‚Äôt want to skip out on it. If you choose to skip out on it, check yourself for other symptoms of hypoxia.

Mountain style is basically adding a twisted order of breadsticks to the crust that encircle it like barbed wire on an old fence post. It goes great with the honey on your table and is satisfying to hold.

My wife has poor genetics and cannot eat gluten, but Beau Jo has magic crust that people with bad genes can also eat. I tried it, it‚Äôs good for magic crust.

You might be concerned about carbs and calories, but rest assured, *Carbs don‚Äôt count in Colorado.*

Patio seating was a pleasant spot to let 7500ft of elevation downshift my day drinking into economy mode.

Chase is a great waitress and we really enjoyed her vibes. Her fun, bubbly attitude really completed it all. Good service is increasingly rare now, so thanks Chase.

Tl;dr eat at Beau Jo‚Äôs

detailedReviews.author: Jeff Morgan
detailedReviews.text:
What a grand old place!.
Beau Jo's was suggested to us some 43 years ago and the place hasn't missed a step in our opinion.
Great pizza, terrific atmosphere, and wonderful service.
To be able to come back after so very long and feel the same magic is a pure joy.
We love our pizza and we love Beau Jo's!

customerMoodAnalysis.sentimentSummary: Customers have positive experiences overall. Your 4.5/5 rating from 100 recent reviews shows solid satisfaction with room for growth.

strengthsPerceived: Customers rave about the unique combination of pizza crust with honey, describing it as "magical" and a "must-try combo." - social media marketing can showcase this strength

The inviting ambiance of the old building and the friendly, attentive staff create a memorable dining experience that customers travel for and reminisce about. - review management can highlight this positive aspect
The pizza is consistently praised as some of the best in Colorado, with specific mentions of unique flavors like the BLT with hot honey crust. - SEO services can leverage this for better visibility
improvementOpportunities: Negative reviews and reputation issues due to poor customer service and food quality - review management can address this concern
Long wait times and crowded conditions - Boostly marketing services can improve this
Lack of atmosphere/ambiance awareness, including unsanitary conditions like flies and dated decor - social media marketing can improve this area

positive.author: awatters52
positive.text: Alyssa P was our server and she was just the nicest. The food was amazing and as always the atmosphere was great. We love this location and travel from Aurora CO just to visit

neutral.author: Josh T
neutral.text: So we like this place it‚Äôs an iconic pizza place in an awesome town. However I ordered a Bloody Mary it was probably the worst Iv ever had in my life. Tomato juice and vodka with a lemon wedge. No rimmer no olive no spice no nothing litterally the ugliest worst thing ever. We also ordered a pizza with additional toppings and they just weren‚Äôt there I dunno pretty average experience.

Her impact was enough for our whole party to agree that we won‚Äôt be coming back anytime soon.

neutral.text: We were pretty bummed this visit. The gluten-free pizza is usually awesome, but this time the crust was lukewarm and kind of odd, like it hadn‚Äôt fully cooked‚Äîeven though the toppings were fine. The mushroom appetizer was also tiny, which was surprising. Our server was super nice but so busy that by the time she checked on us, we were already ready to leave.

negative.author: Hippychick
negative.text:
Went to the Idaho Springs location this summer & boy has it changed ‚Ä¶ and not for the better! It used to be a treat going to this pizza joint, been going there since the 70s.
It‚Äôs soooo crowded, parking can be impossible, be prepared to wait for a table. Once we finally got seated there were so many flies around our table buzzing about, live one‚Äôs & dead ones too. Yuck. The tall guy with long hair literally threw our pizza down onto the table, very rude. Didn‚Äôt speak a word to us. He wasn‚Äôt our waitress,  just dropped off our food‚Ä¶ literally!! The food was meh‚Ä¶ nothing like I remembered. The Beau Joes in Lonetree is better than this experience. Lonetree welcomed us & treated us like they cared. No flies either!
I spent alot of ‚Äúdough‚Äù there in Idaho Springs, it‚Äôs not cheap to have a family of 5 go out for a special occasion. I expected better based on past years. Idaho Springs is just sooo crowded & combine that with traffic from hell & not so great food- we won‚Äôt be back. ‚òπÔ∏è

negative.author: Seema Mahajan
negative.text: The pizza was really good but they charge for each topping and also add 20% tip which came down to huge bill including taxes, so 50 dollars for one small size pizza was definitely not worth.

negative.author: Marbelis Acosta Niesing
negative.text:
My husband had this place recommended to him, but it turned out to be the worst pizza experience of our lives.

I first ordered an Espresso Martini, but they didn‚Äôt even have coffee liqueur. Then I tried a Margarita, it was the worst I‚Äôve ever had. It was extremely acidic and overly sweet, totally undrinkable. I even went up to the bar to get a glass of soda water to mix it and later asked for another one, but nothing worked, so I basically paid $11 + tax for a drink I couldn‚Äôt even touch. My husband couldn‚Äôt drink it either.

We ordered the Pacific Plantation, and it was a disaster. The slices fell apart like mush, the sauce was watery and flavorless (just onion), and the pineapple and mushrooms were soggy and bland. It was practically soup, I had to place my slice on a napkin just to try to eat it. The only thing somewhat decent in this ‚Äúpizza pur√©e‚Äù was the pepperoni. Honestly, a frozen pizza, or even a Costco pizza, would have been way better.

To make matters worse, our server (an older gentleman) seemed annoyed and unfriendly from the start, and we were charged full price at 5:30 pm instead of happy hour.

We wasted $80 on this terrible experience. 0% recommended. Never again!
